reference.title: Ant tasks and script
reference.shortdesc: This topic lists detailed Ant tasks and script.

section.p: The build process including pre-process can be called by using Ant script. There are four major Ant script files:

dlentry.dd: The main Ant script file includes the other three ant scripts and provides main targets for every output style.

entry.ph: The path and name of the input file. This argument should be in the same upper or lower case with the filename on file system.
entry.note: This parameter must be provided if dita.input and dita.input.dirname not be provided.

entry.ph: The name of the input file .
entry.note: This parameter must be provided if args.input not be provided. And this parameter must be used together with the dita.input.dirname parameter. The result of this combination is equivalent to use only the args.input parameter. It is an alternative way to specify the path and name of the input file.

entry.ph: The input directory which contains the input file.
entry.note: This parameter must be provided if args.input not be provided. And this parameter must be used together with the dita.input parameter. The result of this combination is equivalent to use only the args.input parameter. It is an alternative way to specify the path and name of the input file.

The parameter to specify whether each index entry should display within the body of the text itself. Only "no" and "yes" are valid values.
The parameter to specify whether copy user specified css files to the directory specified by args.csspath. Only "no" and "yes" are valid values.

The output file extension name for generated xhtml files. Typically, '.html' or '.htm' can be used as the extension name for the generated xhtml files. You can also specify other extension name. The default is '.html'.
User specified css file, it can be a local file or remote file in the web.

entry.note: args.csspath should end with '/' if it is a URL, or file separator for local path.

The name of the file containing XHTML to be placed in the BODY running-footing area.

section.title: Sample ant script
section.p: These ant scripts are in ant directory. They are simple and easy to learn. From these files, you can learn how to write your own Ant script to build your own process.

Here is a sample template for writing an Ant script that executes transformation to xhtml in ant directory <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?> <project name="sample_xhtml" default="all" basedir=".."> <import file="${basedir}${file.separator}conductor.xml"/> <property name="dita.extname" value=".xml"/> <target name="all" depends="sample2xhtml"> </target> <!-- revise below here --> <target name="sample2xhtml" depends="use-init"> <antcall target="dita2xhtml"> <param name="args.input" value="@DITA.INPUT@"/> <param name="output.dir" value="@OUTPUT.DIR@"/> </antcall> </target> </project>

After you write the input file and output directory to overwrite @DITA.INPUT@ and @OUTPUT.DIR@, the script can execute the transformation from your input to xhtml by this command. The property of dita.extname is a global variable with which you can set the file extension name of the topic file. The default dita.extname is .xml. You can also set it to .dita according to OASIS DITA recommendation. ant -f ant/template_xhtml.xml All of targets we use here are defined in conductor.xml. Therefore, you need to import that file before calling the target.
